Package maze

Interface InterfaceableMaze

All Superinterfaces:
Graph
All Known Implementing Classes:
Maze
public interface InterfaceableMaze
extends Graph
This interface describes a maze which can be modified by an interface.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from interface maze.Graph

    distant

  • Method Details

    • newMaze

      void newMaze​(int height, int width, int boxType) throws UnexpectedBoxTypeException
      Creates a new maze of given dimensions, filling it with a given type of boxes.
      Parameters:
      height - height of the new maze.
      width - width of the new maze.
      boxType - type of the boxes to fill the maze with.
      Throws:
      UnexpectedBoxTypeException - if the given box type does not match with any.

    • read

      void read​(java.io.InputStream in) throws java.io.IOException, ReadingException
      Reads a new maze from a given input stream.
      Parameters:
      in - input stream to be read.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.
      ReadingException - if the method was unable to parse the stream correctly (bad format for example)

    • write

      void write​(java.io.OutputStream out) throws java.io.IOException
      Writes the maze in a given output stream.
      Parameters:
      out - output stream to be written.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • isOpened

      boolean isOpened()
      Indicates whether the maze is opened.
      Returns:
      true if the maze is opened, false otherwise.

    • close

      void close()
      Removes the current boxes and closes the maze.

    • display

      void display​(java.io.PrintStream out)
      Displays the maze in a given output stream.
      Parameters:
      out - output stream to be written.

    • show

      void show​(BoxFlag flag)
      Requires the maze to show a flag when displaying.
      Parameters:
      flag - flag to be displayed.

    • hide

      void hide​(BoxFlag flag)
      Requires the maze to hide a flag when displaying.
      Parameters:
      flag - flag to be hidden.

    • showAllFlags

      void showAllFlags()
      Requires the maze to show all flags when displaying.

    • hideAllFlags

      void hideAllFlags()
      Requires the maze to hide all flags when displaying.

      Returns the number of vertices in the maze.

      size in interface Graph
      Returns:
      The number of vertices in the maze.

      Returns the height of the maze.
      Returns:
      The height of the maze.

      Returns the width of the maze.
      Returns:
      The width of the maze.

    • getSelection

      java.util.ArrayList<Vertex> getSelection​(BoxFlag flag)
      Returns a list of all the boxes carrying a flag.
      Parameters:
      flag - flag to be searched.
      Returns:
      A list of all the boxes carrying flag.

    • setSelection

      void setSelection​(java.util.ArrayList<Vertex> sel, BoxFlag flag)
      Adds a flag to several boxes.
      Parameters:
      sel - boxes to be flagged.
      flag - flag to be added.

    • clearSelection

      void clearSelection​(java.util.ArrayList<Vertex> sel, BoxFlag flag)
      Removes a flag to several boxes.
      Parameters:
      sel - boxes to be unflagged.
      flag - flag to be removed.

    • clear

      void clear()
      Clears all flags of all boxes.

    • addFlag

      void addFlag​(int x, int y, BoxFlag flag) throws MazeOutOfBoundsException, NullBoxException
      Adds a flag to a box.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate of the box.
      y - Y coordinate of the box.
      flag - flag to be added.
      Throws:
      MazeOutOfBoundsException - if the coordinates are out of the maze dimensions.
      NullBoxException - if there is no box to the given coordinates.

    • remFlag

      void remFlag​(int x, int y, BoxFlag flag) throws MazeOutOfBoundsException, NullBoxException
      Removes a flag from a box.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate of the box.
      y - Y coordinate of the box.
      flag - flag to be removed.
      Throws:
      MazeOutOfBoundsException - if the coordinates are out of the maze dimensions.
      NullBoxException - if there is no box to the given coordinates.

    • getRoot

      Vertex getRoot()
      Returns the current root.
      Returns:
      The root of the maze. If there is none, null is returned.

    • remRoot

      void remRoot()
      Removes the current root if it exists.

    • setRoot

      boolean setRoot​(int x, int y) throws MazeOutOfBoundsException, NullBoxException
      Adds a BOX_START flag to a box. Only one box in the maze can be flagged as root at a time.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate of the box.
      y - Y coordinate of the box.
      Throws:
      MazeOutOfBoundsException - if the coordinates are out of the maze dimensions.
      NullBoxException - if there is no box to the given coordinates.

    • addRow

      void addRow​(int pos, int boxType) throws MazeOutOfBoundsException, UnexpectedBoxTypeException
      Adds a row.
      Parameters:
      pos - position of the new row.
      boxType - box type to fill the row with.
      Throws:
      MazeOutOfBoundsException - if pos exceeds the height of the maze.
      UnexpectedBoxTypeException - if the given box type does not match any.

    • remRow

      void remRow​(int pos) throws MazeOutOfBoundsException
      Removes a row.
      Parameters:
      pos - position of the row to be removed.
      Throws:
      MazeOutOfBoundsException - if pos exceeds the height of the maze.

    • addCol

      void addCol​(int pos, int boxType) throws MazeOutOfBoundsException, UnexpectedBoxTypeException
      Adds a column.
      Parameters:
      pos - position of the new column.
      boxType - box type to fill the column with.
      Throws:
      MazeOutOfBoundsException - if pos exceeds the width of the maze.
      UnexpectedBoxTypeException - if the given box type does not match any.

    • remCol

      void remCol​(int pos) throws MazeOutOfBoundsException
      Removes a column.
      Parameters:
      pos - position of the column to be removed.
      Throws:
      MazeOutOfBoundsException - if pos exceeds the width of the maze.

    • addBox

      void addBox​(int type, int[] args) throws MazeOutOfBoundsException, InvalidBoxArgumentsException, UnexpectedBoxTypeException
      Adds a new box with given type and arguments.
      Parameters:
      type - type of the new box.
      args - an array of arguments to provide the constructor with.
      Throws:
      MazeOutOfBoundsException - if the first two arguments given, corresponding to x and y, are out of maze borders.
      InvalidBoxArgumentsException - if the given arguments could not be parsed by the Box constructor.
      UnexpectedBoxTypeException - if the given box type does not match any.

    • remBox

      void remBox​(int x, int y) throws MazeOutOfBoundsException
      Removes the box at the given coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate of the box.
      y - Y coordinate of the box.
      Throws:
      MazeOutOfBoundsException - if the coordinates are out of maze borders.

    • getBox

      Vertex getBox​(int x, int y) throws MazeOutOfBoundsException
      Returns the vertex at given coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - X coordinate of the vertex.
      y - Y coordinate of the vertex.
      Returns:
      The vertex at the given coordinate, might be null.
      Throws:
      MazeOutOfBoundsException - if the coordinates are out of maze border.

    • drawIDs

      int[][] drawIDs()
      Returns a matrix of drawing IDs for drawing a tile map.
      Returns:
      A matrix of drawing IDs.
